website_summaries.verdict: With a quality design and two cups for less than the cost of a single cup from some other brands, this stands out for being a good value for its price.
pros: In addition to being affordable, customers appreciate that this style holds up well with continued use and is soft and flexible
cons: The design is thinner than some other brands, and the removal stem is a bit shorter than others, which may make removal a bit more difficult

customer_reviews.title: An absolute necessity during my cycle
customer_reviews.text: I was new to menstrual cups when I bought these. I really enjoy using my menstrual cup and am much better at putting it in after some practice. I ended up using a nail clipper to completely trim the handle off. My cervix is lower than average so it was uncomfortable with the handle on. Now it's not even noticeable when it's in correctly. I also use my cup during ovulation for ttc. I don't know why more women don't use these. It's so much better than the typical tampons and pads. The price is right. The quality is great. I can see these lasting for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Humble BeeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless you want to spend 30 minutes digging for it. Runners: beware.
customer_reviews.text: I have NO idea how the heck these have such a high rating. Go to the one star comments and you'll find more like this one. I tried this for two periods... after it got totally STUCK, TWICE, I threw it out. The first time I thought I inserted it too high- ha. It migrates. 30 minutes spent freaking out by myself is SO not worth it. Runners- beware. One of the times it occurred while on a run. Running drives it up. This product was a waste of money but more importantly.. a frightening experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The stem was too short and I could not get a good grasp so it took 10-20 minutes to pull it ...
customer_reviews.text: First time user and it was an awful experience. The stem was too short and I could not get a good grasp so it took 10-20 minutes to pull it out. IDK if I'll try a different one but this one definitely doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Too rigid
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems a bit hard/stiff to use. I'd rate myself intermediate for using cups. This one is the least comfortable one I've used. Inserting is hard due to the stiffness. Its comfortable during wear and I've never had any leaks. But then when it comes time to remove it, its difficult to release suction. This makes it uncomfortable for removal which is not good. I use it very infrequently and will be in the market for a replacement soon.
customer_reviews.author: Makeda

customer_reviews.title: Will never use a tampon Again!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely IN LOVE with the cup!!! I’m always ruining several pairs of underwear every month when I get my period- tired of it!! Making sure I have tampons on hand- not anymore!! You can’t feel it - AT ALL!! Super easy to insert. The first few times I was a little frustrated when trying to remove it bc the suction power is STRONG but you get a hang of it once you get a hang of it- it helps a lot if you kinda push it out while your pulling and it pops right out!!
customer_reviews.author: amr1465

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about these. I was excited to not need to use tampons! I ordered the small (pre-birth) and it was way too big and uncomfortable for me. I should mention I also use the NuvaRing. I don’t know if that affected it, but I just couldn’t use it. It was irritating the opening and I had to take it out after 10 minutes. It also hurt when I took it out.
customer_reviews.author: Grill

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve done it sooner
customer_reviews.text: There was a learning curve. Just wanted to start with that. The first time, I used it over a weekend so I could get the hang of it at home without worrying about having slips at work. Never had a slip. I couldn’t believe how carefree this is once I got the hang of it. I don’t use that stick part to pull it out, I just reach up and grip the cup. Squeeze until suction is released, and out. Important: wash with soap every time. But it is amazing to have such an easy solution that minimizes waste and my spending every month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better late than never!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in my 40s and am SO tired of tampons and pads, but was apprehensive about trying a cup. On a hunch, and reinforced by some reviews, I ordered the "pre-childbirth" size, despite having delivered two kids... Rolled the dice on size, and this brand, because of the low price...wasn't sure if I could convert after this many menstrual cycles, and this was a low-cost experiment. It's definitely an adjustment, and requires a new level of familiarity with my plumbing, but now, two months in, I'm converted! I am so glad I can now (knowledgeably) present cups as an option to my two tween daughters, and KNOW that their monthly experiences will be so much better as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you’ve had a baby.
customer_reviews.text: VERY DIFFICULT TO REMOVE, it had me freaking out, I’ve never been pregnant so I bought the small one but they need to make an extra small , it’s definitely leak proof but very hard to remove and the little tail it has to help remove it doesn’t work at all, maybe a little loop would be better
customer_reviews.author: @kendylbobbie

customer_reviews.title: Only if you’ve had a baby!
customer_reviews.text: I have not had children and this cup was WAY too big. Painful to put in and take out. It is comfortable while it’s in if you do it right. You have to push it alllll the way up there though, which is also very difficult if you are still tight.
customer_reviews.author: Desp4it

customer_reviews.title: So much freedom on your period
customer_reviews.text: There is a bit of a learning curve, but I'd never go back. Much more comfortable than tampons but just as convenient. I wore a pad for extra protection at first, but now, after four cycles, I'm trash free for two months. Having two makes life much easier, even in public, pop one out and the other in and go, although I don't often change more than at home because usually I'm back within 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Works great and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I started off with a Diva cup over a year ago but then after losing it I thought it would be best to get more than one! So I saw this double pack and purchased it and have no complaints. I trimmed the end just a little bit to help with comfort. Works just as good as the Diva Cup, no need to spend the additional money on more expensive options. These work great and they get the job done as expected!
customer_reviews.author: Nenosorac

customer_reviews.title: A Murder In The Toilet
customer_reviews.text: I have such a love hate relationships with these cups. Sometimes they are uncomfortable and push on my bladder making me feel like I have to pee when I don't. Sometimes they leak. They hurt during insertion. And then sometimes, like on road trips or while sleeping, they are a dream. You can leave them in for way longer than tampons and when they don't leak they work so well. The cleanup is frightening, but its still a nifty invention. Pro Tip: Never forget to flush or people will suspect you miscarriaged into the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Maegan Cruz

customer_reviews.title: A nice addition.
customer_reviews.text: They are a nice alternative to have. I can't say that I am able to completely give up pads but I have reduced my tampon use by far. The fit on the cup is good but there is a learning curve on use. You really do need a pad as backup when you wear this unless you are putting it on and off in the shower everytime you use it. There's a lot more cleaning of yourself and clothing than with pads or tampons. It does cut way down on waste and purchasing tampons. You need fewer pads, too.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: First time user. Easy to put in but a little difficult/painful to remove. I wore it on my heaviest day and just barely made it to 5 hrs, luckily I was wearing a pad cuz it started to leak by the 5th hour. I read on another brand that it's equivalent to 2 super plus tampons, so if you change a super plus every hour or 2 on your heaviest day, you'll only get about 4 hours out of this cup. I was hoping to use it for 8-12 like the package said but not a chance. I'll definitely keep using these
customer_reviews.author: patapu

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several different menstrual cups and this is the first one that I've found to be truly comfortable and easy to remove. This pack is cheaper for 2 cups than the Diva Cup is for one. It's nice to have the 2 because then I can keep one in my bathroom and one in my purse. Works really well, very little leakage (only when I don't empty it frequently enough) and very comfortable. 10/10 would recommend, no hesitations.
customer_reviews.author: KimberlyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I read great reviews on these so wanted to try
customer_reviews.text: After having children, tampons became very uncomfortable for some reason. The string seemed to rub. I read great reviews on these so wanted to try. It only took one or two times to figure out how to get it in properly, comfortably, and no leaking. I can wear this for a whole day and not worry or all night. It is a little gross and messy to pull it out and dump the blood, but I don't think any more so than yanking a bloody tampon out. Love love and will not go back to tampons. I ordered a size small and fits great. I have had 2 children, but am a petite woman.
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorBoyMom

customer_reviews.title: Stop waiting and BUY THIS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this!!! The Dutchess cup is a life saver! I’m not running to the bathroom every hour or so! I do check it every five hours the first couple of days of my cycle but the last couple of days it’s great all day with no checks until bed time <3 ! Perfect for sports, exercising, swimming! It’s just awesome! I’ve had two csections and the size B is perfect for me 💖 Definitely get this product if you’re tired of constantly having to change your pad or tampon... if you’re a minor ignore my review completely if you do not have your parents premission!
customer_reviews.author: Lace Thomas

customer_reviews.title: No more pads/tampons!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these since september and have had no issues. I used to rely on a combination of tampons and pads, and I don't even keep those around any more. These are the first and only period cups I've tried. They do get stained after a bit, but that doesn't really bother me personally. I found them to be easy to place and remove. It does take a bit of practice. Once you get the hang of it you should have no leaking unless the cup fills up. Definitely recommend trying it. I have a very heavy period and don't have to change this as often as I used to have to change tampons!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Will Never Go Back!!!
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to disposable feminine products! Pads were too thick and the glue would stick to my thighs and I would feel like I was wearing a diaper; pads would stick too and would get smelly. Tampons would leak and move around and were always a risk when doing yoga. These cups do the job! I can wear them hiking and camping, doing hot yoga, playing soccer, bouncing on a trampoline, etc and not have to worry anything! No glue to stick to my thighs and break out in a rash, no smell, no leaking. Easy to remove and clean. It's weird to use them the first couple times but trust me, you will never go back!
customer_reviews.author: emily White

customer_reviews.title: To me, the best feminine product
customer_reviews.text: This product has saved me so much money. And I am environment conscious as well. Also I get usually heavy periods and I had to change pads constantly during the day. It felt like I was carrying diapers. And forget about during sleep. There always had to be a towel down. No matter what. This product has simplified my life. To the point that I have told all of the females that I know to give it a try. Though it says 12 hours I tend to change mine every 8. And the best of all, there is no smell. And you dont feel a thing.
customer_reviews.author: Denisa Seferaj

customer_reviews.title: i was a skeptic.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I was the BIGGEST skeptic and this has changed my life. I had a few concerns before using, -thought it would be hard to use -thought it would be uncomfortable -thought it would get stuck -thought it would be messy. -thought it would leak i've never used a cup before. wow. i forget that its in. this has been great!!!! so comfortable that you cant even feel it. easy to insert and easy to remove. I was honestly shocked at the lack of mess. I will NEVER go back to tampons. and i do not use pads. 10/10 recommend. SAVE THE EARTH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO comfortable, takes some effort to remove.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first venture into the menstrual cup world, and I am never going back. This thing is so easy to put in and super comfortable to wear during the day and night. The only issue I have is that I wish the grip on the bottom was just a little longer, it can be.... interesting... to remove. Needed to limber up a bit and mentally prepare myself sometimes. Not a deal-breaker for me because its so easy and comfortable to use 96% of the day. The few minutes at the end of the day that I spend trying to get the damn thing out, is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria AndrewsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Won't open
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few brands of these so far (I lose things easily and have to keep rebuying them), and these by far are the worst. They won't "snap open" when they are inserted, because the rubber is to thin. There just isn't enough tension, so it stays folded and will not open, which pretty much defeats the purpose. I've given it several tries, and used both colors, thinking maybe one was defective, but they are the same. Honestly, just spend the extra $10 and get one of the better known brands. I didn't retrun them (because yuck), but I will be getting something a little thicker that may actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well while EXERCISING
customer_reviews.text: This product so far is working really well for me. I am really satisfied with it. It didn't take me long to figure out how to insert it. Once it is in place, I don't even notice it. Removal is somewhat difficult, but I was expecting that. I have mountain biked while wearing it and done several hundred squats with no issue. So glad I found an alternative to tampons. Edited this review from 5 to 4 stars. Removal is difficult. A ring to grab would have been better than the extension provided. It is hard to get a decent grip on that. Otherwise everything is great!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know how I lived without it
customer_reviews.text: Honestly the best thing that ever happened to me in recent history. *edit several periods later* Still the best thing that has ever happened to me. It fits so comfortably and I can wear it overnight without worrying about leaks. I empty it in the morning, pop it in and don’t worry about it for an entire shift at work. Doesn’t even feel like I have a period. I’ve only had to empty it in a public restroom once and it wasn’t a big deal. Once you get the hang of it there’s no mess to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Emely

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long to give cups a try?!? Over the last year I've suffered from allerigic reactions to several brands of maxi pads and tampons. Including brands that boast of being free and clear. Periods can already be uncomfortable enough without dreading an allergic reaction. Right after the cups we're delivered I sanitized them and followed the directions to insert the cup. I got it to seal in oht first try! I've been wearing it all day, went to the gym and did my usually day to day things without any leaks or the cup moving. I am definitely a very happy woman! I've already recommended it to several people.
customer_reviews.author: Epiphany

customer_reviews.title: Why have I not found these sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by 2 friends I decided to take the plunge and try these. I have heavy periods on on day 2 and sometimes 3 and awful symptoms so I was reluctant. I didn't need to be... wow... easy to use and I do believe some of my symptoms were relieved. I'm so pleased. On my heavier days, I did remove and empty it more often but lighter days it was in all day no fuss. My work means I don't have an office bathroom to use so this made that stress obsolete as I didn't need to keep changing 😁👍
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Life changing for me and my teenager daughter
customer_reviews.text: Used mine for over 2 years and now bought these for my teenager. This cup is Life changing. I went from changing a tampon every 2 hours to emptying the cup every 8. I can sleep through the night and not stand up to a mess. My daughter said this raised her confidence while at school too because she no longer is in fear she stained her clothing. To anyone with a heavy flow I highly suggest you try this. It takes a few days to perfect insertion but once it is in it does its job. I suggest viewing YouTube videos because it helped my daughter tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: elvia lopez

customer_reviews.title: why don't they teach us about this in school
customer_reviews.text: this is amazing and i wish i would've known about it sooner! why don't they teach this as an option when you're getting "the talk" at school? there's no leaking, it's comfortable, and you can do anything with it in. i am not messy, stinky, sticky, or anything else you can think of that comes with periods. i can swim just fine. i can go to an amusement park and not have to worry about a thing while i'm there. i just empty it in the morning and in the afternoon and i'm good. just boil it to sterilize it between uses and tuck it away in your bag. i'm already saving so much money by using this vs tampons.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it can hold more
customer_reviews.text: I waited to try this out. It works but on my heavy day, I had to taken it out about every 2.5 hours because it will start to overflow and would feel the warmth of my menstrual leaking. For tampons, it's every 45 minutes on a heavy day so I guess it's not too bad. Thejonoy thing is when you are working, hope they have private bathrooms cuz it would be really incovenient and can get kind of messy pulling the cup out.
customer_reviews.author: jerry chanh ly

customer_reviews.title: Tampons NEVER again
customer_reviews.text: My sister told me to buy one of these YEARS ago. I always thought they were so gross. I finally got sick of paying so much for tampons so I decided to finally give them a try. I LOVE them. I've used them for 4 periods now and they dont leak at all, they are easy to put in, and as long as you relax they are easy to take out and clean. Please at least give them a try!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie M

customer_reviews.title: Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving these a 5-star because they really are great. For me, I did have some leakage but it's difficult for me to get these types of cups suctioned correctly on heavy flow days. Fortunately, it's great every other day of my period just would suggest a light liner on heavy days. These cups are not too hard or too soft, they're a great in-the-middle leaning more toward soft which I love. They're pretty, easy to clean, and much more earth-conscious. Thank you for your product!
customer_reviews.author: ALyn

customer_reviews.title: First cup and i love it
customer_reviews.text: First time trying this was weird but now it's so easy. Recommended a c fold and some water based lube to help you insert, and turn so the open part of the fold is to the perineum which helps it pop open a little easier. Have way less cramping with this product vs tampons and i think it speeds up the process of menstruation as well, i am through now in 4 days and used to be 5 to 7.
customer_reviews.author: aprilspies

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Takes getting used to but super happy never having to use tampons again!
customer_reviews.text: I will never EVER use a tampon again. This is awesome! I even on some level feel healthier when I want to destroy everything during my hell week. I have PCOS so my periods are super heavy. The small cup has held it's own. On the bad days I have to clean it a few times a day but I am not checking for leaks nearly as much as when I did tampons. I love that I have reduced my plastics greatly by using this instead of the applicators for the dozens of tampons I went through in a month.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Fae

customer_reviews.title: 110% recommended
customer_reviews.text: Literally it was my first time trying it and I was a little nervous after the 1st or 2nd try I got right. The only thing I have to say is be careful with long nails because scratches are really painful and make sure you’re relaxed, also be gentle. If you feel it on your butt then it’s likely you did it correctly. Didn’t leak, just use a panty liner or pad just in case you didn’t get all the blood when wiping after inserting the cup. No regrets, comfortable and I don’t even feel it there. Removal is a little tricky or slippery so make sure you have a good grasp on the bottom of the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Jlynn

customer_reviews.title: They work, would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been seeing these show up a lot lately on social media and decided to give one a try. I was super excited to try these to cut down on the number of tampons and pads I was using on a monthly basis because they’re expensive and horrible for the environment. It takes some practice putting them in and taking them out but once you have it down you really can’t even tell it’s there. They say you can go 6-12 hours between changing and I found that to be pretty spot on and I didn’t have a single issue with them leaking. I have definitely been recommending these to some friends who were considering trying them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: BUY THESE!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are a game changer! I no longer have to worry about carrying tampons and pads around everywhere I go. The cups are comfortable and you don’t even notice if you have one in. You never have to worry about the “dry tampon” feeling again! They are also much more eco friendly and produce significantly less waste than tampons and pads. If you’re squeamish, emptying them may take a little getting used to, but they are a wonderful alternative to pads and tampons. (They can also be left in for twice as long as tampons. Really great for busy and forgetful people) Good value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia A.

customer_reviews.title: I love it!! Don’t knock it till you try it!!
customer_reviews.text: The first month I kinda struggled to get used to it, but I’m on my 2nd month and I absolutely love it!!! It took a little practice but it goes in and comes out with ease. I use coconut oil to moisturize before I insert and that has been a game changer!! I’ve already recommended this to many of my friends and family. I normally have really bad cramps during my periods and since I’ve started using the cup, my cramps have been manageable and not nearly as severe. As a mom of 3 (all vaginal births) the douchess cup has changed my life!! I don’t hate my period as much as I used to lol 5 Stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Schott

customer_reviews.title: The best thing ever! No more tampons!
customer_reviews.text: An absolutely fantastic purchase! I love being able to wear one of these all day and not have to worry with tampons! The cup is still kind of big for me, even thought i bought the pre-pregnancy size. So i do have to fold it and it’s was a bit uncomfortable when first putting it in, but use a little lube and it slips in much easier. It also can be a bit harder to remove than a tampon, since the tip is actaully inside your vagina and you have to reach in to pull it out,. But overall it is great, How did i use tampons for so long?!?
customer_reviews.author: Jack Stretch

customer_reviews.title: It hurts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because It's friendly to the environment, however my process using this has been painful. It hurts to much when I put it and take it out also, it makes me wanna pee all the time which it's uncofortable. I saw many reviews and most of the people seems to be amazed by the product. I'm still thinking that is beacuse I'm new and I'm learning how to use it so I'm gonna keep trying for some more time (a good thing about the cups it's all the money I save since is reusable)
customer_reviews.author: Daniela Tique Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Better than name brands! Even converted my friend with these.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used Diva Cup until now, and I don’t see a reason to go back! Exactly the same functions , but I like the value and size of these more. The size is smaller and easier to insert, but the stem is longer (which doesn’t really impact anything - it’s not THAT much longer) I even got my neighbor into using cups now! Good thing I was able to give her one of the ones in this pack haha She was a tampon gal until now!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Better than Diva cups!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously used the Diva cup before purchasing these dutchess cups. I was a bit skeptical at first because these are so cheap, but these cups work great! I had zero issues with leaks and could wear it for 12 hours (I have a light-medium flow). Previously with the diva cup I would occasionally have issues where after I put it in, it wouldn't pop into place and I would leak. These cups so far went into place easily! They are a bit smaller than the diva, but that hasn't seemed to matter. I ordered the smallest size.
customer_reviews.author: Sharky

customer_reviews.title: ❤1st time cup user
customer_reviews.text: 2nd cycle with my dutchess cups. I love them! I feel so much more comfortable and cleaner then with tampons and pads! It took a few insertions and retrvials to get my technique down. I always insert and retrieve in the shower. I squat down and relax to insert and when i stand up i can feel it unfold into place. Retrevial is also in a squat position, I bear down and it comes right out with a quick tug on the stem. I love not having to change my tampon every time I go pee! I've never had a leak, and I'm never going back to pads and tampons❤
customer_reviews.author: SoloBabe92

customer_reviews.title: CupLife is the Life for me!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would've switched to using a cup years ago! Ladies, get rid of those tampons! I love this product and stand by #cuplife lifestyle. The silicone cleans really easy with no mess. It is comfortable and you can keep it in for a lot longer than a tampon (around 10 hours). I also love the two different sizes provided. I have successfully converted several of my friends over to using the Menstrual Cups and they love it as well.
customer_reviews.author: MissLyssa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I was really worried about getting the right size & about them leaking. I tried the small since I have never actually birthed a child(I had a miscarriage at 22 weeks)but when I had my period I use them & I will never used anything else again. Super comfortable- I never felt weird having it in & it worked great while being active & through out my normal day. I have & would recommend these to any women. They are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Stewart

customer_reviews.title: yess
customer_reviews.text: after an unfortunate DivaCup accident involving my lovely puppy, i was searching for a quick, cheap replacement. i was nervous about buying this because i didn’t know if it would fit right or if it would work. let me just say, I LOVE THIS!! more than DivaCup! I got size B, and it’s only slightly smaller than the DivaCup, but it actually works better for me. also it says this size is for those over age 25. I beg to differ! overall very happy with this product and the price point😊
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving it. I got them at a great price and they have already paid for themselves in just a couple months. I forget I'm even on my period! I got the smaller size (I am in my mid twenties, have never given birth). I cut the stems off because they bothered me, but that's just a personal choice. I do still buy "light" liners because the cup isn't perfectly leak proof on my heavy days. I also wear them when I work out. I notice no difference in performance in the cup during these activities which is another plus!
customer_reviews.author: Erin R

customer_reviews.title: Size also by age
customer_reviews.text: As of right now I give one star in details on sizing. After I received packaging and read instructions does it mention that size is also depending on age, not just child birth. Until I try the correct size for my body will I truly be able to give honest judgement Instructions in package Size a- given birth or over 25 Size b- not given birth or under 25 For the ladies that are over 25 and haven’t given birth, I hope this helps in ordering. The idea is great and it isn’t uncomfortable by any means, I just had some leakage so I’m hoping correct size will fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Campolei

customer_reviews.title: This works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ladies!!!! Let me say this. I did not use this for my periods but for TTC. This worked for me on the first try. I kept the cup in for 12 hours max and found out I was pregnant two weeks later after use. I did see that the size is a small only if you didn’t have kids but I had two children by c section and this worked just fine for me. Make sure to wash and boil first before you first use it. Ladies your welcome.
customer_reviews.author: Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who have sensitive bladders
customer_reviews.text: I've tried the saalt soft (regular) and diva cup (size 2), but could still feel them a bit since I have a sensitive bladder. I also have endometriosis, so I do get very heavy and painful periods. If you can get the Dutchess cup in properly, it is an outstanding cup. Couldnt even feel it! However, like with most softer cups, getting this thing to form a proper seal can be an issue. This would be my goldilocks cup if only the seal would form easier. With the diva cup, the seal pops right away. You have to work a little more with this cup.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: but it's so nice not having to change it more than 2-3 times ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used these cups for 2 months now. It has been a learning curve, as I've never used a cup before. It has taken some getting used to, but it's so nice not having to change it more than 2-3 times a day. I have had a little bit of "leakage" some days but I researched it and I think it's because it wasn't fully suctioned. I tried a different fold, and I think it worked better. I took one star away because I felt discomfort from the little tip at the end. I did cut it off (no holes in the actual cup, just cut a very little bit off) and that fixed the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine

customer_reviews.title: love
customer_reviews.text: I have returned back to getting my cycles. So, this is my first try using a cup after being enraged that after 15 yrs pads still feel like sticky sweaty diapers. I've tried these a few times. I love this thing. I've only had 1 leak happen and I think it was bc it wasn't low enough. It can be a bit pesky getting it out with the suction effect but over all I love it. I work 13 hr days with it worry.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: Insertion & use of this product is great. It took me a little while to get a proper seal to avoid leaks, but I never felt it & was able to go about my day. Taking it out is a different story, just this morning I spent 5+ minutes trying to get it out. Luckily I have nails so I could pinch onto the ribs of the stem, but the suction was to strong & wiggling barely worked. Once it's almost out it still suctions to the labias which is painful. I think a ring instead of a stem on the end would be very helpful, but I will no longer be using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Disposable pads and tampons? Never again
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these about a year ago and I didn't want to leave a review right away because I want to see how they would hold up over time. I'm happy to report back that every single one of my periods with these cups have been comfortable and much less inconvenient than traditionally changing out pads and tampons. My only gripe with these is that I suggest to use both cups during a period and swap them after emptying the cups because there is a smell from prolonged use. Otherwise everything has been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: My experience as a first time user
customer_reviews.text: I admit I was hesitant on this purchase but it payed off! I received this item a day before I started my cycle and it was a weird adjustment since I alternate from pads and tampons and am in constant worry of leaks and orders. However with this I actually didnt have any links and I held over night and throughout my workday. No leaks no ordors. I defainlty had to get up in there and adjust the cup a few times but once it was up there it was great. And taking it out is still a little difficult and uncomfortable sometimes but there is an adjustment curve. Defiantly not going back to tampons now!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Comfort and suction power are great, I haven't had an leakage and I can't even feel it inside of me but it took me about a month to get it out with ease, I would recommend getting one that has a longer catch for you to pull it out with better ease. I think these are much better than tampons. Someone should invent a cleaning kit that come with this purchase though. I have to use handicap stalls for the sinks in order to clean it before putting it back in.
customer_reviews.author: Rory

customer_reviews.title: Saving the earth one pad at a time
customer_reviews.text: These are a great alternative for pads and tampons. I hate how single use those items are and so I found this and gave it a try, it took some getting use to but I like it so much more than pads or tampons. It is low maintenance and perfect for even outdoor activities like swimming and hiking. Not to mention how much cheaper this is compared to the alternatives. Strongly recommend trying it!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Hall

customer_reviews.title: Aunty Flo’s monthly visit
customer_reviews.text: I am so in awe of these things and have no idea why I was so resistant in purchasing these for so long. I read all the reviews and decided to go with these and I am so glad because they are perfect for me. These are soft and firm enough to handle the job without feeling like I’m ripping my insides when taking them out like the other brand that is a bit too firm in my experience. I had no issues with any leakage at all and these are just the best things when it comes time for auntie Flo’s monthly visit.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Best product ever
customer_reviews.text: At first it was foreign and strange to put in... I looked up a couple videos on how to do it as the instructions are vague that come in packaging.. I've just completed day 1 and night 1... I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT.... my 3rd removal (this morning) I was able to remove the cup without spilling anything... i dont feel it up there as long as u push it far enough in (like a tampon) I slept with it... no spills.... i feel less cramping... I highly recommend this!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ramos

customer_reviews.title: One of the two cups doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 pack with two cups about 3 months ago. One of the cups works very well. The second cup, seemed to leak despite fitting it per the guidelines. It leaked and stained a little in the middle of my work day, which was quite problematic frankly cuz I had gotten used the dryness and perfection with which these cups work. But other than that, these cups have been life changing. I am pretty sure I cannot get a replacement for the other cup, but I hope the manufacturers see this :)
customer_reviews.author: Sumedha Pareek

customer_reviews.title: You won’t even know it’s there!
customer_reviews.text: Y’alllll. I originally bought this bc apparently it can help women get pregnant.. I haven’t used it for a menstrual cycle yet, but this thing is COMFORTABLE. I don’t even feel it. It’s a little scary at first because it has to go way up in order to be comfy. But I’m simply amazed as far as how well it stays in place and is pain free. In order to remove it, it’s easier to push with your cervix and have it surface itself instead of having to reach way up inside. I’m so glad I made this purchase! I don’t think I’ll be switching to tampons anytime soon, but will update as I go!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: I'm never going back, but I might try others
customer_reviews.text: Definitely takes some getting used to, but I'll never go back to tampons. I'm just not sure if this is the right fit for me. It's very difficult to open up after I insert it. Might be too wide for me. Just takes some time. Once it's in probably, its great. I've only leaked twice in 2 cycles, and not a lot because I felt it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soooo comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO TAMPONS!!! I originally ordered this product because I was frustrated that even with a ultra tampon I was still leaking through. I was also frustrated with the fact that I would spend so much money on tampons for them not to work properly... I also felt that with tampons you’re just producing so much contamination for the world I will say this I was very hesitant to switch to this I’ve heard that they are messy and a little inconvenient but it could not be further from the truth. the application is super easy and a little messier than your average tampon but nothing that is outrageous
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Cups I've Used Yet
customer_reviews.text: I've been using menstrual cups for a little over a year and haven't been able to find the one that seems to work perfectly, but this is the closest I've come. It's a good price for the two pack. They work as described and I've experienced almost no leaks. They are comfortable, but can be slightly difficult to remove. You may have to practice. Learning how to insert them correctly is key to avoid leaks and discomfort and the information that comes with these cups is helpful. I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Volpe

customer_reviews.title: Eahh, not bad though,everyone is different
customer_reviews.text: This product is a hit and miss, not so easy to put in, once in still have to wear panty liners, and I’m not a heavy leaker, I like it but it tends to get lost in there and kinds twist it’s self causing discomfort.. some days it good I don’t feel it and others I just feel uncomfortable.. feel like the this isn’t long enough for me to be able to pull since it likes to get lost
customer_reviews.author: Stania Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great product
customer_reviews.text: Once you do this, you will never go back to tampons or pads. It is scary at first, but you need to finally get these! They have changed my life. I don’t have to worry constantly about my heavy flow day or running to the bathroom all the time on my period. If you are considering them, I would say go for it! And these are a great price compared to the other ones on the market!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Super soft and bendy
customer_reviews.text: I love this cup, it’s nice that it comes in a two pack as well. For years I didn’t use menstrual cups because I heard that they can interfere with IUDS. Then I learned that’s not really the case and came to amazon to look at the options. I used the divacup about 10 years ago and I’m blown away by all the new cups on the market. This one was cheap and seemed functional enough. So I ordered it and it works great. It’s even more comfortable than my divacup was and easier to insert. I like that it comes in colors so when it eventually discolors slightly it’s not as much of an eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Better than the diva cup
customer_reviews.text: So much cheaper than the diva cups and work just as good. They are a little bit harder to get out only because the little nub is a little smaller than I’m used too and the material isn’t as hard. But it’s a good thing the material isn’t so hard, makes it more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chorrace

customer_reviews.title: Powerful suction, hard to remove.
customer_reviews.text: The suction is very powerful and it's a struggle to get the stem out. I went with the size guidelines for a women of my size (5'2", 130 lbs and no children) and it never fully fills but it's very hard to remove as the stem is very short. However customer service is great and believes the large would be too large so I'll have to discontinue use but they were very nice and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Caryn Czebieniak

customer_reviews.title: I keep experiencing leakage no matter what I do
customer_reviews.text: I keep experiencing leakage no matter what I do. I have played around with folding it in different ways, inserting it higher, lower, rotating it... nothing works! The package insert says product B is for women who have not given birth to a child OR are younger than 25. I have not given birth to a child but I am in my early 30s. I wonder if this is the issue. Nowhere in the product description do they mention the age limit.
customer_reviews.author: Diana S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for the Diva Cup
customer_reviews.text: After years of usage, I decided to replace the Diva Cup because of the discoloration. Even though there was no problem as far as functionality goes, I just always felt iffy about the discoloration at the tip. And this feels almost identical (the shape and size) except the tip doesn't have that annoying open end so much easier to clean, and because it isn't clear silicone, I don't have to worry about discoloration as much. Overall, very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Milly Koa

customer_reviews.title: I Never Knew How Much I Needed These
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about using menstrual cups at first, but these are amazing. No more spending too much for tampons! I have been using them for several months and I will never go back to pads and tampons. They are more comfortable and much more suitable for my lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you think it’s going to be easier, think again.
customer_reviews.text: Although I think it’s good in theory, I used it for five days but I don’t think I’ll use this again. It wasn’t messy, but at times when taking it out it would be so far up I’d get nervous, and to be honest I don’t think it has enough of a grip for first time users not to feel scared that it’s up there. If you have a job working all day, this wouldn’t be particularly convenient. And keep in mind that it can be messy and a big change from tampons I like how it’s good for the environment but I just couldn’t get comfortable using it. Slightly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ciara

customer_reviews.title: Keep using it to get better
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the first time because my friend said they changed her life for the better. I had a tough time putting it in and taking it out, BUT while it was In I honestly didn’t even feel it. But I dreaded taking it out in fear of spilling it or just the sight of my own blood collected in a cup. It wasn’t as bad as I thought it would be, but it definitely takes some getting use to.
customer_reviews.author: Ciera Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Dutchess vs Diva Cup
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as replacements for the diva cup. I have a heavy period and had a c-section. I started using menstruals cups because tampons became painful for me the months following my daughters birth. The fit and feel of the Dutchess’s cup is softer and better, they are easier to put in and take out. However during my heaviest days I had to be emptying close to every 4 hours. I found that the perfect solution for me is to use the Dutchess cup on light days and the diva cup on heavy days. Made a huge difference for me.
customer_reviews.author: DR26

customer_reviews.title: Use antibacterial soap to wash?
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. One thing sketchy about the product is that on the manual in the package says to wash it with antibacterial soap while another manufacturer advises against it. I'm kinda confused about which to believe.... I googled it and they say not to use antibacterial soap because you can never wash soap off completely and it can kill some good bacteria in your vagina which can lead to yeast infection.
customer_reviews.author: Lkjjkj

customer_reviews.title: Takes some time, but it's worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, it took me about 3 months to get the hang of using a menstrual cup. The first month was frustrating, but I listened to what others said and tried again. I've figured out how to mange heavier flow days and am 95% leak proof at this point. I think I will continue to get better at placing the cup. I've already saved more money than what I paid for these cups and the biggest bonus is that I'm not flushing away paper and plastic waste every month!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B

customer_reviews.title: Buy TODAY!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this cup. I reluctantly purchased the smaller size even though I have had 3 cesareans. I thought since none of my kids actually came through the canal, the pre-pregnancy size might work, and it did! I have yet to have a leak. I can sleep with it, which is one of the biggest perks in my book. I also have not had to purchase or bother with maxi pads. I could insert a really gross dog story here, but I’ll spare you the details. Either way, this cup is everything I could have asked for and more... effective, economical and just better for my body. I’d give it 10- stars if I could! You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: LaToya

customer_reviews.title: Good menstrual product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! This is my first menstrual cup. It has many benefits comparing to the pads and tampons. I think I'll keep using it. Pros: keeps outside clean and dry. Large content capacity. In the days I need 8 super tampons, I only need to dump the cup 3times. No string hanging outside, so no worry about contamination. No risk of TSS. No overdrying of inner mucus. Cons: a little messy to clean. Hard to insert and pull out. I have to dig my fingers deep inside to handle it. But I think I'll get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Zhang

customer_reviews.title: My cramps dont hurt anymore! Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I used to have to take 8 ibuprofen a day because of how bad my cramps were. They would immobilize me! Switched to this and then BOOM, only had to take 1 ibuprofen for the first day of my period. First time I used it, I thought it got stuck...then I researched how to take it out and its been a breeze ever since. I've recommended this to all my friends. Literally has changed my time of the month for the better!
customer_reviews.author: Macey

customer_reviews.title: New product
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to put inside, and very unhappy when you're loosing your blood. Make sure you change the cup every hour cause it's fulfilling very fast. Then to take off it's a pain in the ass cause short and if it's full so make sure you do it gently cause it's spreed out everywhere. Need more time to use it properly
customer_reviews.author: Eliyah

customer_reviews.title: Well..
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping to eliminate my need for tampons. But I just couldn't do it. I know these are healthier and safer and more eco-friendly but I tried putting one of these in just for a minute and it felt way too uncomfortable and I immediately started worrying about getting it out. Maybe I'll give these another shot eventually but beware, they're not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Like with some of the other reviews I was skeptical using these cups, but after using for two cycles I love em. The suction works great once you get used to the placement with no leaks. Defiantly fold the cup in half, and into a C shape and remember to clean your hands before and after. Short nails are also great so you don’t hurt yourself! I really should have gotten these cups years ago, and there’s no odor like when I use pads. It’s also much more comfortable than a tampon, no dryness at all.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn Asuncion

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a product like this. The directions included are very helpful. Using this, I didn't feel like it was there. No problems with insertion and removal-- leaning back during removal helps in my opinion. It's worth getting two to switch out. No spills. The only thing that would make this better would be if there was a ring at the end to pull out-- just for my own peace of mind. Otherwise, this was great, glad I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smells horrible after a few days use
customer_reviews.text: This is the second brand of menstrual cups I've tried. I've had them for about 6 months now. These work well with no leaks. A little harder to place properly than the first brand I had. My cycles are relatively heavy and last for 6-7 days. Usually by day 3 these cups smell horrible. Like disgusting. And it's the cup itself. I haven't found anything that improves the smell other than airing it out for about a week. When I go back to using my original cup of a different brand I have no smell issues.
customer_reviews.author: Janel

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased another brand after I bought these cups and regretted buying the other brand. These cups are soft and flexible. They fold easily and pop into place easily. I love how I can wear a cup for 12 hours and not have to worry about changing a tampon. I also love how when I am in the pool, lake, or at the beach, I’m not thinking about a wet string being visible. These cups are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this item 3 1/2 stars only because it did not work for me. I think I ordered too small of a cup because my worst fear about these happened and I almost got it stuck inside of my body! I am 25 years old and I have never had a child so I ordered the smaller cup thinking that would be right for me and I think it was too small. It did do it’s job and held for 12 hours without leaking so that’s why I am giving it a couple of stars. It has traumatized me enough that I will probably not ever try these again.
customer_reviews.author: Ashxo

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy bleeding
customer_reviews.text: This cup works great for light to moderate days. I would not recommend it for heavy bleeding. It will create an uncomfortable mess of a situation. You’re still going to need, the underwear and pads for back up. You might have to practice getting it in a few times. Once adjusted to comfort, you’re good. But, I did find it a little difficult to remove, as the suction power is strong. Good luck ladies.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer
customer_reviews.text: Once you get the hang of using a cup it will literally change your life! Suggested to replace yearly, so this was my second time buying. So much better than tampons, never going back.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Cheatham

customer_reviews.title: Hard to take out
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost I'd like to speak about the one plus about this product. Once inserted you cannot even tell that it is there. Unfortunately, that is my only plus. I had really high hopes for this product. Unfortunately, the stem to pull the cup out is way too short;It took me about five hours to take it out. As a result of not being able to take it out after several attempts, my body tensed up ultimately making it harder to retrieve it.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: I love luna/diva/moon/menstrual cups!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been a cup user and advocate pushing 10 years now. I think this one is softer than the Diva Cup. Soft, perfect size (pre-birth), cute colors. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because I think the tab is 1-2mm too short, and the staining is meh. I had a Diva Cup for years, and that staining wasn’t as dark as this one. It could also be the pink/purple colors that make it look more brown over time too.
customer_reviews.author: JMN

customer_reviews.title: Life changing! Worth it! Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cups in March 2019 and have been using it since then. Initially it was weird and leaked and made me think that I wasted my money but after getting the hang of it and learning how exactly does it work, it truly is life changing. I workout 5 times a week and this makes it more comfortable than before. This is great for price. I went for it thinking that even if doesn't work at least I wouldn't be wasting as much but it truly is worth every penny. RECOMMENDED!!
customer_reviews.author: Sonam Pansari

customer_reviews.title: Good substitute for Divacup
customer_reviews.text: I had used a Diva cup for almost 2 years and started having issues with it leaking. Replaced it with these and hoped the quality would be as good without spending $40. Suction is great and it's comfortable. Only complaint is that the ribs at the base of the cup aren't as well defined so it's tricky to get a grip and pull the cup out. It's doable, just not as easy as the divacup. Overall would purchase again and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: It is a little difficult to remove I’m not gonna lie there’s a learning curve, but overall it does the job. It has a tiny bit of leakage, but well worth it in my opinion. All you need is a panty liner with this and you’re good to go, much safer/healthier than tampons. It is a little annoying to clean it, but necessary to not smell.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Very effective product.
customer_reviews.text: Took some time to get used to inserting properly and getting my comfortable, but don’t give up after first attempt. I kept trying as I was determined to stop using tanpons. After 4 days of practice I became a pro and these worked wonderfully. Love that they come in a pair. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice

customer_reviews.title: Not for a low cervix!
customer_reviews.text: This cup just wasn't right for my body. I'd get dull cramps after wearing the cup for a while. Turns out this cup is too long for my cervix...even the small size. Also THEY LEAKED. I really wanted to like this cup but after two periods and having the same dull cramping when the cup was in I'm think this cup just isn't right for me~
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Diva...without a diva price.
customer_reviews.text: I usually use the Diva cup. However, they just upped the price. So I decided to try an alternative. These are comfortable. I think it compares well. However, the diva cups is a little better, but not by much. I wouldn't wear these at night if you are really heavy and you sleep more than 8 hours. Leaks could be a possibility. I would still buy/recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: So I like these better than my old cup because the stem doesn’t dig into me yet sometimes these are hard to remove because of the short stem.. so I guess it’s one or the other. Still getting used to the cup. I find it’s best to sit to take it out. Sometimes if wait to do it in the shower and I find that’s much harder and can actually push it up farther.. But also the plastic feels cleaner than my last cup. These clean up real nice and insert smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Got a Copper/Paraguard IUD? Cramps and bleeding solved!
customer_reviews.text: I was like most people who was scared to even try this product, but after I got the Copper IUD put in a bled so much heavier I had to do something better. ONE amazing thing I didn't realize it did was elevate the horrible cramps too! Anyone who has the Copper IUD/Paraguard IUD know that extra bleeding and cramping comes with it. This has made everything so much better! The only thing that was slightly bad, was I ended up getting a small yeast infection, so at night I won't wear it just during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

product_meta.title: Dutchess Menstrual Authentic Original Cups Set of 2 with Free Bags - Small (B) - No 1 Economical Feminine Alternative Protection for Cloth Sanitary Napkins for Menstruation
product_meta.description:
Color:Set of 2 (Pink and Purple)| Size:Small (Pack of 2)| Style:PRE-ChildbirthSafety Information
Please Sterilize your Dutchess Reusable Menstrual Cups before use.

Indications
Used during woman's menstrual cycle instead of tampons or pads.

Ingredients
100% Medical Grade Silicone

Directions
Depending on Menstrual Flow, Empty your menstrual cup 2-5 times daily. Can be worn safely overnight. Upon emptying, just rinse your Dutchess Cup with water. Sterilization can be achieved simply by boiling the silicone cups for 5 minutes before every monthly period, or by using a quality sterilizing liquid.

Legal Disclaimer
Please seek professional medical advice if you have or think you may have a medical gynecological condition prior to using a Menstrual Cup. If you feel any discomfort, discontinue use immediately and consult physician. These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration.

Statements regarding dietary supplements have not been evaluated by the FDA and are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease or health condition.
feature_bullets: SET OF 2 Re-usable Menstrual Cups - Pink and Purple. Carry one in the Handbag, keep one for Home. Best Feminine Alternative Protection for Cloth Sanitary Napkins.

DON'T BE FOOLED by cheap imitation cups. Choose Authentic Original Dutchess Cups. FDA Registered. Small Size B - Suitable for petite framed women who have not given birth, or who have had a c-section, or under 25 years old.
SO COMFORTABLE TO WEAR and EASY grip stem for ease of removal and ridge-less body so its simple and easy to clean.
100% BODY-SAFE Super Soft Medical Grade Silicone as used in Infant Pacifiers. Phlalate Free, Latex Free, Dioxin Free, BPA free.
LASTS FOR YEARS - Save Money & Care for the environment and make the economical and eco friendly choice. 100% Waterproof

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
